description: Payroll processing, tax calculation, and employee management troubleshooting organized by UDAS layers

user.issue: User needs help setting up payroll for the first time
diagnostic_questions: Have you subscribed to QuickBooks Payroll (it's a separate paid service)?
Do you have all your employee information ready (SSN, address, tax forms)?
Have you determined your pay schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly)?
solutions: Subscribe to QuickBooks Payroll: Payroll → Get Started → Choose plan ($45/month + $6/employee)
Gather required info: Employee SSN, I-9 forms, W-4 forms, state tax forms
Set up company payroll info: Payroll → Payroll Settings → Company setup
Add employees one by one with complete tax information

user.issue: User doesn't have proper permissions to access payroll features
diagnostic_questions: Are you the company administrator or do you have payroll permissions?
Can you see the Payroll tab in your QuickBooks navigation?
Did the company owner give you access to payroll functions?
solutions: Ask company admin to grant payroll permissions: Settings → Manage Users → Edit your role
Verify you're logged into the correct company file
Check if payroll subscription is active and paid up
Contact company owner to upgrade your user permissions

data.issue: Payroll tax calculations are incorrect or not working
diagnostic_questions: Are the employee's tax withholdings set up correctly on their profile?
Have you updated the latest tax tables in QuickBooks?
Are the employee's salary/hourly rates entered correctly?
solutions: Update employee tax info: Payroll → Employees → Edit employee → Tax info tab
Download latest tax tables: Payroll → Payroll Settings → Tax Setup → Update
Verify employee pay rates: Payroll → Employees → Edit employee → Pay info
Check state tax settings if you operate in multiple states

data.issue: Employee data or payroll history problems
diagnostic_questions: Are you missing employees from your employee list?
Do you see duplicate paychecks for the same pay period?
Is the payroll history showing incorrect amounts or dates?
solutions: Check for inactive employees: Payroll → Employees → Include inactive
Delete duplicate paychecks: Payroll → Payroll History → Delete duplicates
Verify payroll records: Payroll → Reports → Payroll Summary
Re-enter missing payroll data if records were lost

diagnostic_questions: At what step does the payroll process get stuck or fail?
Are you seeing any specific error messages?
Have you tried processing payroll in a different browser?
solutions: Clear browser cache and cookies completely
Try processing payroll in incognito/private browsing mode
Use a different browser (Chrome works best for payroll)
Disable browser extensions that might interfere
Process one employee at a time if batch processing fails

diagnostic_questions: Are you set up for direct deposit or printing physical checks?
Have employees' bank account information been verified?
Are you using the correct check stock for printing?
solutions: Verify direct deposit setup: Payroll → Payroll Settings → Direct Deposit
Check employee bank info: Payroll → Employees → Edit → Direct Deposit tab
Use compatible check stock for printing paychecks
Test print alignment before running full payroll
Contact bank if direct deposits are being rejected

diagnostic_questions: Is your business bank account connected and active in QuickBooks?
Have you verified your business bank account for payroll purposes?
Are you experiencing banking issues outside of payroll as well?
solutions: Re-verify your business bank account for payroll: Payroll → Payroll Settings → Bank Account
Contact your bank to ensure ACH transactions are enabled
Check if your account has sufficient funds for payroll + fees
Verify your business bank account routing and account numbers
Allow 1-2 business days for bank verification process

system.issue: External tax service or government system issues
diagnostic_questions: Are you trying to file tax forms during a government shutdown period?
Have you received any notices from tax agencies about system maintenance?
Are other businesses reporting similar tax filing issues?
solutions: Check IRS and state tax agency websites for system status updates
Wait for maintenance periods to complete before retrying
File tax forms manually if electronic filing is unavailable
Contact QuickBooks Payroll support for alternative filing methods
Keep records of attempted filings for compliance purposes
